alert.note: Alert for Burke (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 3:53PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Burke County through 445 PM EST... At 353 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gough, or 10 miles west of Waynesboro, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Plant Vogtle, Sardis, Alexander, Gough, Burke County Airport, Girard, Vidette, Shell Bluff, Di- Lane Wildlife Management Area, Magruder and Rosier. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina.
